For example, a small compass measurement error will, in general, contribute an error to each of the derived vector's east and north components, the sign of the errors' product depending not on the measurement, but on the vector's orientation. (The only exception is when the vector happens to be parallel to a coordinate axis, in which case the contribution along that axis might be considered insignificant.) The errors in the "observed" components, therefore, are generally correlated, with the
being negative for vectors oriented NE-SW and positive for vectors oriented NW-SE.
